Get Directions

Cityscape views and open air

in the heart of NOMAD

If New York is the center of the world, then Royalton Park Avenue is its epicenter. Ideally situated in the NoMad neighborhood, just steps from the Empire State Building, the iconic Flatiron Building, and bustling Union Square. The Royalton Park Avenue is truly located in the center of the city's most influential happenings.

Attractions

  • Madison Square Park
  • Flatiron Building
  • Eataly
  • Union Square
  • Empire State Building
  • Madison Square Garden

Madison Square Park is just blocks away from the hotel and located between Fifth and Madison Avenue between 23rd & 26th Street. Seven acres of public green space where you can see stunning art, gorgeous gardens and attend exciting events and programs.

Madison Square Park

The Flatiron building is possibly one of the most photographed buildings in the world. Located at 175 Fifth Avenue, it’s a short walk from the hotel.

Flatiron Building

Eataly is a vibrant Italian Marketplace that features several sit down restaurants, food and beverage counters, a bakery, retail items and a cooking school.

Eataly

There is so much to see and do in Union Square. Stroll through the park, play a game of chess or stop by the year-round Greenmarket.

Union Square

One of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, this beloved building is one of the true icons of the Manhattan skyline. Built in 1931, the Empire State Building remains one of the greatest feats of American ingenuity.

Empire State Building

Madison Square Garden is "The World’s Most Famous Arena" where you can enjoy the best sporting and entertainment events in NYC.  Located between 7th and 8th Avenues from 31st to 33rd Streets, it is situated atop Pennsylvania Station.

Madison Square Garden
